title: People with stressful jobs are 13% less likely to climax during sex, survey reveals
text:

If you struggle to climax during sex , your job may be to blame, according the results of a new survey.

Researchers from Remedy Review surveyed over 800 people about their work stress , their partner’s work stress, and their sex lives.

The results revealed that participants with high-stress jobs had lower levels of sexual satisfaction, with 74% even admitting to turning down intimacy because of high amounts of work-related stress.

Remedy Review explained: “Our data shows that stressed workers (and their partners) are far less happy overall with their sex life: High-stress partners were 23 percentage points less likely to be satisfied with their sex life than low-stress partners.”

(Image: Getty)

Stress in the office also appears to play a role in sexual performance.

While people with low-stress jobs reached climax 79% of the time, those in high-stress only climaxed 69% of the time.

Meanwhile, people with low-stress jobs said that they couldn’t perform sexually 9% of the time, while those in high-stress jobs struggled 20% of the time.

Remedy Review added: “Stress impacts sexual performance for both men and women, and it can even lead to what medical professionals call ‘performance anxiety.’

“It’s totally normal but is no fun to deal with.

"Add feelings of routine and less excitement to an inability to climax, and you’ll probably come out with complete dissatisfaction.”
description: A survey by Remedy Review has revealed the effects that stress at work can have in the bedroom
